isis.stitle: TSI 04-12-32 - Convert The International® VT 365 2004 Model Year Engine Emission Calibration (Highway Use) To Non-Road (Off-Road) Engine Emission Calibration

subjectgroup.subject: Convert The International® VT 365 2004 Model Year Engine Emission Calibration (Highway Use) To Non-Road (Off-Road) Engine Emission Calibration

geninfo.para: Non-road conversion is being offered to eliminate the catalytic converter due to plugging and performance issues on vehicles that operate at low speeds and loads.

regulation.para: It is against the law to operate a vehicle on any public road or highway with an engine calibrated for non-road emissions.

geninfo.para: This conversion must not be performed on engines that will continue to operate on public roads or highways.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death or damage to the engine or vehicle, make sure the transmission is in neutral, the parking brake is set, and wheels are blocked before performing diagnostic or service procedures on the engine or vehicle. Read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of the Engine Service manual and the Engine Diagnostic manual.

geninfo.para: The following are requirements to convert highway use International® VT 365 2004 MY diesel engine calibration to non-road calibration:

item.para: Calibration of the ECM must be PRG2PJ50 or later or the engine must be upgraded to meet these requirements.

International® VT 365 MY 2004 engines with ECM not calibrated to PRG2PJ50 or later will have a Federal Emission Label (FEL) and will not have a special right side exhaust tube assembly with an EGR scoop attached.

The FEL must be removed, right side exhaust tube assembly (1843175C1) must be removed and replaced with the special right side exhaust tube assembly (1845235C1), and the ECM calibrated to PRG2PJ50 or later.
The engine must be 175 horsepower, or must be converted to a 175 horsepower engine (Engine Family Rating Code (EFRC) 2111).

geninfo.para: There are a number of steps that need to be performed by the dealer to send and receive information from International and the environmental staff at the Vehicle Programming Center.
The following steps are suggested to perform the non-road conversion and obtain the new non-road emission label. The Vehicle Programming Center will provide the actual steps:

item.para: Change the needed components on the vehicle.
Remove the FEL and right side exhaust tube assembly (1843175C1).
Install special right side exhaust tube assembly with EGR scoop (1845235C1), if required, to upgrade the engine.
Calibrate the ECM, if required, to meet PRG2PJ50 or later requirements.
Enable Road Speed Limit and program for 24 miles per hour or less.
Remove Catalyst muffler, replace with muffler, part 2587076C1.
Retrieve and upload the ECM and vehicle parameters, using the EZ Tech® or compatible computer and program, to International.
Fax the signed form to the Vehicle Programming Center. The program center will process the parameters and notify the dealer.
Receive the parameters and programs of the vehicle for non-road emission calibration.
Install new program in ECM.
Send the following to International Environmental Staff D-575, attention Re-configuration Team, Melrose Park, IL., to obtain the new emission label, part 1854565C1:
Legible copy of the line set ticket with the full engine serial number
Old emission label and FEL (if applicable)
Copy of Dealer work order
Copy of the signed horsepower quote
Dealer's address and name of person at dealer who needs to receive the new emission sticker
Affix new non-road emission label in place of the old emission label.

regulation.para: It is against the law to operate a vehicle on any public road or highway with an engine calibrated for off-road emissions.
